meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rampant.
meanings.sent1: The rampancies of the weeds in the garden made it difficult to walk through.
meanings.sent2: The rampancies of the virus led to a rapid increase in cases.
meanings.sent3: The rampancies of the puppy's energy were both exhausting and adorable.
meanings.sent4: The rampancies of misinformation on social media can be harmful to society.
meanings.sent5: The rampancies of the wildfire left a trail of destruction in its path.

meanings.definition: The act or instance of spreading uncontrollably or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The rampancies of rumors in the small town caused unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent2: The rampancies of laughter filled the room during the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The rampancies of ice cream flavors at the shop made it hard to choose just one.
meanings.sent4: The rampancies of emotions overwhelmed her during the heartfelt speech.
meanings.sent5: The rampancies of joy in the children's laughter brightened up the playground.
